Detached buildings containing quantities of unclassified detonable organic peroxides in excess of those set forth in Table 415.6.5 shall be located in accordance with Table 443.2.1(2). TABLE 449.4.2ORGANIC PEROXIDES—DISTANCE TO EXPOSURES FROM DETACHED STORAGE BUILDINGS OR OUTDOOR STORAGE AREAS ORGANIC PEROXIDE CLASS MAXIMUM STORAGE QUANTITY (POUNDS) AT MINIMUM SEPARATION DISTANCE Distance to buildings, lot lines, public streets, public alleys, public ways or means of egress Distance between individual detached storage buildings 50 feet 100 feet 150 feet 20 feet 75 feet 100 feet I 2,000 20,000 175,000 2,000 20,000 175,000 II 100,000 200,000 No Limit 100,000a No Limit No Limit III 200,000 No Limit No Limit 200,000a No Limit No Limit IV No Limit No Limit No Limit No Limit No Limit No Limit V No Limit No Limit No Limit No Limit No Limit No Limit For SI: 1 foot = 304.8 mm, 1 pound = 0.454 kg. Where the amount of organic peroxide stored exceeds this amount, the minimum separation shall be 50 feet.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Liquid-Tight Floor
body: In addition to the requirements of Section 415.12.8, floors of storage areas shall be of liquid-tight construction.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Electrical Wiring and Equipment
body: Electrical wiring and equipment in storage areas for Class I or II organic peroxides shall comply with the requirements for electrical Class I, Division 2 locations.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Smoke Detection
body: An approved supervised smoke detection system in accordance with Section 907 shall be provided in rooms or areas where Class I, II or III organic peroxides are stored. Activation of the smoke detection system shall sound a local alarm. Exception: A smoke detection system shall not be required in detached storage buildings equipped throughout with an approved automatic fire-extinguishing system complying with Chapter 9.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Maximum Quantities
body: Maximum allowable quantities per building in a mixed-occupancy building shall not exceed the amounts set forth in Table 415.6.5. Maximum allowable quantities per building in a detached storage building shall not exceed the amounts specified in Table 449.4.2.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Storage Arrangement
body: Storage arrangements for organic peroxides shall be in accordance with Table 449.4.7 and shall comply with all of the following: Containers and packages in storage areas shall be closed. Bulk storage shall not be in piles or bins. A minimum 2-foot (610 mm) clear space shall be maintained between storage and uninsulated metal walls. Fifty-five-gallon (208 L) drums shall not be stored more than one drum high. TABLE 449.4.7 STORAGE OF ORGANIC PEROXIDES ORGANIC PEROXIDE CLASS PILE CONFIGURATION MAXIMUM QUANTITY PER BUILDING Maximum width (feet) Maximum height (feet) Minimum distance to next pile (feet) Minimum distance to walls (feet) I 6 8 4a 4b Note c II 10 8 4a 4b Note c III 10 8 4a 4b Note c IV 16 10 3a, d 4b No Requirement V No Requirement No Requirement No Requirement No Requirement No Requirement For SI: 1 foot = 304.8 mm. Not less than one main aisle with a minimum width of 8 feet shall divide the storage area. Distance to noncombustible walls is allowed to be reduced to 2 feet. See Table 449.4.2 for maximum quantities. The distance shall be not less than one-half the pile height.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Location in Building
body: The storage of Class I or II organic peroxides shall be on the ground floor. Class III organic peroxides shall not be stored in basements.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Contamination
body: Organic peroxides shall be stored in their original DOTn shipping containers.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Explosion Control
body: Indoor storage rooms, areas and buildings containing unclassified detonable and Class I organic peroxides shall be provided with explosion control in accordance with Section 919.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Standby Power
body: Standby power shall be provided in accordance with Section 2702 for the following systems used to protect Class I and unclassified detonable organic peroxide: Exhaust ventilation system. Treatment system. Smoke detection system. Temperature control system. Fire alarm system. Emergency alarm system.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Fail-Safe Engineered Systems
body: Standby power shall not be required for mechanical exhaust ventilation, treatment systems and temperature control systems where approved fail-safe engineered systems are installed.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Use
body: The use of organic peroxides in amounts exceeding the maximum allowable quantity per control area indicated in Table 307.1(1) or 307.1(3) shall be in accordance with Sections 414 and 415 and this section.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Oxidizers, Oxidizing Gases and Oxidizing Cryogenic Fluids

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Scope
body: The storage and use of oxidizing materials shall be in accordance with this section and Sections 414 and 415. Oxidizing gases shall also comply with Section 440. Oxidizing cryogenic fluids shall also comply with Section 442. Exceptions: Display and storage in Group M and storage in Group S occupancies complying with Section 414.2.5. Bulk oxygen systems at industrial and institutional consumer sites shall be in accordance with NFPA 55.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Quantities Not Exceeding the Maximum Allowable Quantity Per Control Area
body: The storage and use of oxidizing materials in amounts not exceeding the maximum allowable quantity per control area indicated in Section 414.1.6 shall be in accordance with Sections 414 and 450. Oxidizing gases shall also comply with Section 440.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Special Limitations for Indoor Storage and Use by Occupancy
body: The indoor storage and use of oxidizing materials shall be in accordance with Sections 450.2.1.1 through 450.2.1.3.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Class 4 Liquid and Solid Oxidizers
body: The storage and use of Class 4 liquid and solid oxidizers shall comply with Sections 450.2.1.1.1 through 450.2.1.1.4.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Group A, E, I or U Occupancies
body: In Group A, E, I or U occupancies, any amount of Class 4 liquid and solid oxidizers shall be stored in accordance with the following: Class 4 liquid and solid oxidizers shall be stored in hazardous materials storage cabinets complying with Section 414.14. The hazardous materials storage cabinets shall not contain other storage.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Group R Occupancies
body: Class 4 liquid and solid oxidizers shall not be stored or used within Group R occupancies.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Offices and Retail Sales Areas
body: Class 4 liquid and solid oxidizers shall not be stored or used in offices or retail sales areas of Group B, F, M or S occupancies.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Classrooms
body: In classrooms of Group B, F or M occupancies, any amount of Class 4 liquid and solid oxidizers shall be stored in accordance with the following: Class 4 liquid and solid oxidizers shall be stored in hazardous materials storage cabinets complying with Section 414.14. Hazardous materials storage cabinets shall not contain other storage.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Class 3 Liquid and Solid Oxidizers
body: Not more than 220 pounds (99 kg) of solid or 22 gallons (83 L) of liquid Class 3 oxidizer allowed in storage and use where such materials are necessary for maintenance purposes or operation of equipment. The oxidizers shall be stored in approved containers and in an approved manner.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Oxidizing Gases
body: Except for cylinders of nonliquefied compressed gases not exceeding a capacity of 250 cubic feet (7 m3) or liquefied compressed gases not exceeding a capacity of 46 pounds (21 kg) each used for maintenance purposes, patient care or operation of equipment, oxidizing gases shall not be stored or used in Group A, E, I or R occupancies or in offices in Group B occupancies. The aggregate quantities of gases used for maintenance purposes and operation of equipment shall not exceed the maximum allowable quantity per control area listed in Table 307.1(1). Medical gas systems and medical gas supply cylinders shall also be in accordance with Section 440.11.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Class 1 Oxidizer Storage Configuration
body: The storage configuration of Class 1 liquid and solid oxidizers shall be as set forth in Table 450.2.2. TABLE 450.2.2STORAGE OF CLASS 1 OXIDIZER LIQUIDS AND SOLIDS STORAGE CONFIGURATION LIMITS (feet) Piles Maximum width 24 Maximum height 20 Maximum distance to aisle 12 Minimum distance to next pilea 4 Minimum distance to wallsb 2 Maximum quantity per pile 200 tons Maximum quantity per building No Limit For SI: 1 foot = 304.8 mm, 1 pound = 0.454 kg, 1 ton = 0.907185 metric ton. The minimum aisle width shall be equal to the pile height, but not less than 4 feet and not greater than 8 feet. There shall not be a minimum distance from the pile to a wall for amounts less than 9,000 pounds.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Indoor Storage
body: Indoor storage of oxidizing materials in amounts exceeding the maximum allowable quantity per control area indicated in Table 307.1(1) shall be in accordance with Sections 414 and 415 and this section.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Explosion Control
body: Indoor storage rooms, areas and buildings containing Class 4 liquid or solid oxidizers shall be provided with explosion control in accordance with Section 919.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Automatic Sprinkler System
body: The automatic sprinkler system for oxidizer storage shall be designed in accordance with NFPA 400.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Liquid-Tight Floor
body: In addition to Section 415.12.8, floors of storage areas for liquid and solid oxidizers shall be of liquid-tight construction.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Smoke Detection
body: An approved supervised smoke detection system in accordance with Section 907 shall be installed in liquid and solid oxidizer storage areas. Activation of the smoke detection system shall sound a local alarm. Exception: Detached storage buildings protected by an approved automatic fire-extinguishing system.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Storage Conditions
body: The maximum quantity of oxidizers per building in storage buildings shall not exceed those quantities set forth in Tables 450.3.5(1) through 450.3.5(3). The storage configuration for liquid and solid oxidizers shall be as set forth in Table 450.2.2 and Tables 450.3.5(1) through 450.3.5(3). Class 2 oxidizers shall not be stored in basements except where such storage is in stationary tanks. Class 3 and 4 oxidizers in amounts exceeding the maximum allowable quantity per control area set forth in Section 414.1.6 shall be stored on the ground floor only. section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Separation of Class 4 Oxidizers From Other Materials
body: In addition to the requirements in Section 414.19, Class 4 oxidizer liquids and solids shall be separated from other hazardous materials by not less than a 1-hour fire barrier or stored in hazardous materials storage cabinets.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Contamination
body: Liquid and solid oxidizers shall not be stored on or against combustible surfaces. Liquid and solid oxidizers shall be stored in a manner to prevent contamination.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Detached Storage
body: Storage of liquid and solid oxidizers shall be in detached buildings where required by Section 415.6.5.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Separation Distance
body: Detached storage buildings for Class 4 oxidizer liquids and solids shall be located not less than 50 feet (15 240 mm) from other hazardous materials storage.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Use
body: The use of oxidizers in amounts exceeding the maximum allowable quantity per control area indicated in Table 307.1(1) or 307.1(3) shall be in accordance with Sections 414 and 415 and this section. Oxidizing gases shall also comply with Section 440.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Pyrophoric Materials

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Scope
body: The storage and use of pyrophoric materials shall be in accordance with this section. Compressed gases shall also comply with Section 440.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Quantities Not Exceeding the Maximum Allowable Quantity Per Control Area
body: The storage and use of pyrophoric materials in amounts not exceeding the maximum allowable quantity per control area indicated in Section 414.1.6 shall be in accordance with Sections 414 and 451.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Quantities Exceeding the Maximum Allowable Quantity Per Control Area
body: The storage and use of pyrophoric materials in amounts exceeding the maximum allowable quantity per control area indicated in Section 414.1.6 shall be in accordance with Sections 414 and 415 and this section.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Indoor Storage
body: Indoor storage of pyrophoric materials in amounts exceeding the maximum allowable quantity per control area indicated in Table 307.1(1) shall be in accordance with Sections 414 and 415 and this section. The storage of silane gas, and gas mixtures with a silane concentration of 1.37 percent or more by volume, shall be in accordance with CGA G-13.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Liquid-Tight Floor
body: In addition to the requirements of Section 415.12.8, floors of storage areas containing pyrophoric liquids shall be of liquid-tight construction.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Pyrophoric Solids and Liquids
body: Storage of pyrophoric solids and liquids shall be limited to a maximum area of 100 square feet (9.3 m2) per pile. Storage shall not exceed 5 feet (1524 mm) in height. Individual containers shall not be stacked. Aisles between storage piles shall be not less than 10 feet (3048 mm) in width. Individual tanks or containers shall not exceed 500 gallons (1893 L) in capacity.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Pyrophoric Gases
body: Storage of pyrophoric gases shall be in detached buildings where required by Section 415.6.2.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Separation From Incompatible Materials
body: In addition to the requirements of Section 414.19, indoor storage of pyrophoric materials shall be isolated from incompatible hazardous materials by 1-hour fire barriers with openings protected in accordance with this code. Exception: Storage in approved hazardous materials storage cabinets constructed in accordance with Section 414.14.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Weather Protection
body: Where overhead construction is provided for sheltering outdoor storage areas of pyrophoric materials, the storage areas shall be provided with approved automatic fire-extinguishing system protection.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Use
body: The use of pyrophoric materials in amounts exceeding the maximum allowable quantity per control area indicated in Table 307.1(1) or 307.1(3) shall be in accordance with Sections 414 and 415 and this section.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Weather Protection
body: Where overhead construction is provided for sheltering of outdoor use areas of pyrophoric materials, the use areas shall be provided with approved automatic fire-extinguishing system protection.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Silane Gas
body: The use of silane gas, and gas mixtures with a silane concentration of 1.37 percent or more by volume, shall be in accordance with CGA G-13.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Pyroxylin (Cellulose Nitrate) Plastics

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Scope
body: This section shall apply to the storage and handling of plastic substances, materials or compounds with cellulose nitrate as a base, by whatever name known, in the form of blocks, sheets, tubes or fabricated shapes. Cellulose nitrate motion picture film shall comply with the requirements of Section 409.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Displays
body: Cellulose nitrate (pyroxylin) plastic articles are allowed to be placed on tables not more than 3 feet (914 mm) wide and 10 feet (3048 mm) long. Tables shall be spaced not less than 3 feet (914 mm) apart. Where articles are displayed on counters, they shall be arranged in a like manner.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Space Under Tables
body: Spaces underneath tables shall be kept free from storage of any kind and accumulation of paper, refuse and other combustible material.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Location
body: Sales or display tables shall be so located that in the event of a fire at the table, the table will not interfere with free means of egress from the room in not less than one direction.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Lighting
body: Lighting shall not be located directly above cellulose nitrate (pyroxylin) plastic material, unless provided with a suitable guard to prevent heated particles from falling.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Storage and Handling of Raw Material
body: Raw cellulose nitrate (pyroxylin) plastic material in a Group F building shall be stored and handled in accordance with Sections 452.6.1 through 452.6.7.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Storage of Incoming Material
body: Where raw material in excess of 25 pounds (11 kg) is received in a building or fire area, an approved vented cabinet or approved vented vault equipped with an approved automatic sprinkler system shall be provided for the storage of material.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Capacity Limitations
body: Cabinets in any one workroom shall not contain more than 1,000 pounds (454 kg) of raw material. Each cabinet shall not contain more than 500 pounds (227 kg). Each compartment shall not contain more than 250 pounds (114 kg).

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Storage of Additional Material
body: Raw material in excess of that allowed by Section 452.6.2 shall be kept in vented vaults not exceeding 1,500-cubic-foot capacity (43 m3) of total vault space, and with approved construction, venting and sprinkler protection.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Heat Sources
body: Cellulose nitrate (pyroxylin) plastic shall not be stored within 2 feet (610 mm) of heat-producing appliances, steam pipes, radiators or chimneys.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Accumulation of Material
body: In factories manufacturing articles of cellulose nitrate (pyroxylin) plastics, approved sprinklered and vented cabinets, vaults or storage rooms shall be provided to prevent the accumulation in workrooms of raw stock in process or finished articles.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Operators
body: In workrooms of cellulose nitrate (pyroxylin) plastic factories, operators shall not be stationed closer together than 3 feet (914 mm), and the amount of material per operator shall not exceed one shift's supply and shall be limited to the capacity of three tote boxes, including material awaiting removal or use.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Waste Material
body: Waste cellulose nitrate (pyroxylin) plastic materials such as shavings, chips, turnings, sawdust, edgings and trimmings shall be kept under water in metal receptacles until removed from the premises.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Fire Protection
body: The manufacture or storage of articles of cellulose nitrate (pyroxylin) plastic in quantities exceeding 100 pounds (45 kg) shall be located in a building or portion thereof equipped throughout with an approved automatic sprinkler system in accordance with Section 903.3.1.1.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Sources of Ignition
body: Sources of ignition shall not be located in rooms in which cellulose nitrate (pyroxylin) plastic in excess of 25 pounds (11 kg) is handled or stored.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Heating
body: Rooms in which cellulose nitrate (pyroxylin) plastic is handled or stored shall be heated by low-pressure steam or hot water radiators.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Unstable (Reactive) Materials

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Scope
body: The storage and use of unstable (reactive) materials shall be in accordance with this section. Compressed gases shall also comply with Section 440. Exceptions: Display and storage in Group M and storage in Group S occupancies complying with Section 414.2.5. Detonable unstable (reactive) materials shall be stored in accordance with Section 443.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Quantities Not Exceeding the Maximum Allowable Quantity Per Control Area
body: Quantities of unstable (reactive) materials not exceeding the maximum allowable quantity per control area shall be in accordance with Sections 453.2.1 through 453.2.2.5.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: General
body: The storage and use of unstable (reactive) materials in amounts not exceeding the maximum allowable quantity per control area indicated in Section 415.1.5 shall be in accordance with Sections 414 and 453.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Limitations for Indoor Storage and Use by Occupancy
body: The indoor storage of unstable (reactive) materials shall be in accordance with Sections 453.2.2.1 through 453.2.2.5.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Group A, E, I or U Occupancies
body: In Group A, E, I or U occupancies, any amount of Class 3 and 4 unstable (reactive) materials shall be stored in accordance with the following: Class 3 and 4 unstable (reactive) materials shall be stored in hazardous materials storage cabinets complying with Section 414.14. The hazardous materials storage cabinets shall not contain other storage.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Group R Occupancies
body: Class 3 and 4 unstable (reactive) materials shall not be stored or used within Group R occupancies.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Group M Occupancies
body: Class 4 unstable (reactive) materials shall not be stored or used in retail sales portions of Group M occupancies.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Offices
body: Class 3 and 4 unstable (reactive) materials shall not be stored or used in offices of Group B, F, M or S occupancies.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Classrooms
body: In classrooms in Group B, F or M occupancies, any amount of Class 3 and 4 unstable (reactive) materials shall be stored in accordance with the following: Class 3 and 4 unstable (reactive) materials shall be stored in hazardous materials storage cabinets complying with Section 414.14. The hazardous materials storage cabinets shall not contain other storage.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Quantities Exceeding the Maximum Allowable Quantity Per Control Area
body: The storage and use of unstable (reactive) materials in amounts exceeding the maximum allowable quantity per control area indicated in Section 415.1.5 shall be in accordance with Sections 414 and 415 and this section.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Indoor Storage
body: Indoor storage of unstable (reactive) materials in amounts exceeding the maximum allowable quantity per control area indicated in Table 307.1(1) shall be in accordance with Sections 414 and 415 and this section. In addition, Class 3 and 4 unstable (reactive) detonable materials shall be stored in accordance with the requirements for explosives in this code.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Detached Storage
body: Storage of unstable (reactive) materials shall be in detached buildings where required in Section 415.6.5.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Explosion Control
body: Indoor storage rooms, areas and buildings containing Class 3 or 4 unstable (reactive) materials shall be provided with explosion control in accordance with Section 919.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Liquid-Tight Floor
body: In addition to Section 415.12.8, floors of storage areas for liquids and solids shall be of liquid-tight construction.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Storage Configuration
body: Unstable (reactive) materials stored in quantities greater than 500 cubic feet (14 m3) shall be separated into piles, each not larger than 500 cubic feet (14 m3). Aisle width shall be not less than the height of the piles or 4 feet (1219 mm), whichever is greater. Exception: Materials stored in tanks.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Location in Building
body: Unstable (reactive) materials shall not be stored in basements.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Water-Reactive Solids and Liquids

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Scope
body: The storage and use of water-reactive solids and liquids shall be in accordance with this section. Exceptions: Display and storage in Group M occupancies and storage in Group S occupancies complying with Section 414.2.5. Detonable water-reactive solids and liquids shall be stored in accordance with Section 443.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Quantities Not Exceeding the Maximum Allowable Quantity Per Control Area
body: The storage and use of water reactive solids and liquids in amounts not exceeding the maximum allowable quantity per control area indicated in Section 415.1.5 shall be in accordance with Sections 414 and 454.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Quantities Exceeding the Maximum Allowable Quantity Per Control Area
body: The storage and use of water-reactive solids and liquids in amounts exceeding the maximum allowable quantity per control area indicated in Section 415.1.5 shall be in accordance with Sections 414 and 415 and this section.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Indoor Storage
body: Indoor storage of water-reactive solids and liquids in amounts exceeding the maximum allowable quantity per control area indicated in Table 307.1(1) shall be in accordance with Sections 414 and 415 and this section.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Detached Storage
body: Storage of water-reactive solids and liquids shall be in detached buildings where required by Section 415.6.5.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Liquid-Tight Floor
body: In addition to the provisions of Section 415.12.8, floors in storage areas for water-reactive solids and liquids shall be of liquid- tight construction.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Waterproof Room
body: Rooms or areas used for the storage of water-reactive solids and liquids shall be constructed in a manner that resists the penetration of water through the use of waterproof materials. Piping carrying water for other than approved automatic sprinkler systems shall not be within such rooms or areas.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Watertight Containers
body: Where Class 3 water-reactive solids and liquids are stored in areas equipped with an automatic sprinkler system, the materials shall be stored in closed, watertight containers.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Storage Configuration
body: Water-reactive solids and liquids stored in quantities greater than 500 cubic feet (14 m3) shall be separated into piles, each not larger than 500 cubic feet (14 m3). Aisle widths between piles shall be not less than the height of the pile or 4 feet (1219 mm), whichever is greater. Exception: Water-reactive solids and liquids stored in tanks. Class 2 water-reactive solids and liquids shall not be stored in basements unless such materials are stored in closed, watertight containers or tanks. Class 3 water-reactive solids and liquids shall not be stored in basements. Class 2 or 3 water-reactive solids and liquids shall not be stored with flammable liquids.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Explosion Control
body: Indoor storage rooms, areas and buildings containing Class 2 or 3 water-reactive solids and liquids shall be provided with explosion control in accordance with Section 919.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Use
body: The use of water-reactive solids and liquids in amounts exceeding the maximum allowable quantity per control area indicated in Table 414.2.5(1) shall be in accordance with Sections 414 and 415.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Additive Manufacturing (3D Printing)

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Occupancies
body: Nonindustrial additive manufacturing shall be permitted in all occupancy groups.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Industrial Additive Manufacturing
body: Industrial additive manufacturing shall comply with Sections 455.2.1 through 455.2.9.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Combustible Dusts and Metals
body: Industrial additive manufacturing operations that store, use or produce combustible dust, combustible particulate solids or combustible metals shall comply with Section 426 and this section.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Powder Evaluation
body: Printing powders used in industrial additive manufacturing operations shall be tested for combustibility in accordance with NFPA 484 or NFPA 652 as applicable. A copy of test reports shall be provided upon request.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Combustible (Nonmetallic) Dusts
body: Industrial additive manufacturing operations that store, use or produce combustible (nonmetallic) dusts shall comply with NFPA 654.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Combustible Metals
body: Industrial additive manufacturing operations that store or use combustible metals shall comply with NFPA 484.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Hazardous Materials
body: Industrial additive manufacturing operations that store or use hazardous materials exceeding the maximum allowable quantity limits shall comply with this code.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Inert Gas
body: Additive manufacturing processes that utilize inert gases shall comply with this code. Ventilation or gas detection shall be provided in accordance with this code.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Technical Assistance
body: Where required by the building official, an approved report evaluating the acceptability of technologies, processes, products, facilities, materials and uses associated with the operation shall be provided.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Performance-Based Design Alternative
body: Where approved, buildings and facilities where industrial additive manufacturing is performed shall be permitted to comply with the performance-based design options in Section 414.1.4.3 as an alternative to compliance with the other requirements set forth in this section.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Occupancies
body: Industrial additive manufacturing shall be conducted only in the occupancy groups associated with manufacturing operation and permitted by the this code maximum allowable quantity tables. Where approved, the requirements in Section 455.2.4 shall be permitted to provide the technical basis for determining compliance with Table 307.1(1), Note q.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Storage of Distilled Spirits and Wines

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: General
body: The storage of distilled spirits and wines in barrels and casks shall comply with this section in addition to the other applicable requirements of this code.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Nonapplicability
body: Sections 414 and 444 are not applicable to the storage of distilled spirits and wines in barrels and casks as identified in Section 444.1.1, Item 10.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Spill Control
body: Drainage or containment systems shall be provided by means of curbs, scuppers, special drains or other suitable means to prevent the flow of spills throughout the building.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Ventilation
body: For rooms and spaces where distilled spirits and wines in barrels and casks are stored, ventilation shall be provided in accordance with the Mechanical Code and one of the following: The rooms and spaces shall be ventilated at a rate sufficient to maintain the concentration of vapors within the area at or below 25 percent of the lower flammable limit (LFL). This shall be confirmed by sampling the actual vapor concentration under normal operating conditions. The sampling shall be conducted throughout the enclosed storage area, extending to or toward the bottom and the top of the enclosed storage area. The vapor concentration used to determine the required ventilation rate shall be the highest measured concentration during the sampling procedure. The sampling shall be conducted manually or by installation of a continuously monitoring flammable vapor detection system. The rooms and spaces shall be provided exhaust ventilation at a rate of not less than 1 cfm per square foot [0.00508 m3/(s × m2)] of solid floor area. The exhaust ventilation shall be accomplished by natural or mechanical means, with discharge of the exhaust to a safe location outside the building.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Sources of Ignition
body: Sources of ignition shall be controlled in accordance with Sections 456.4.1 through 456.5.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Smoking
body: Smoking shall be prohibited and "No Smoking" signs provided in rooms or areas where flammable or combustible hazardous materials are stored, dispensed or used.Signs required by this section shall be in English as a primary language or in symbols allowed by this code.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Electrical
body: Electrical wiring and equipment shall be installed and maintained in accordance with the Electrical Code.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Lightning
body: Structures containing barrel storage should be protected from lightning. The lightning protection equipment shall be installed in accordance with the Electrical Code and NFPA 780.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Storage
body: Storage shall be in accordance with this section.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Basement Storage
body: Class I liquids shall be allowed to be stored in basements in amounts not exceeding the maximum allowable quantity per control area for use-open systems in Table 307.1(1), provided that automatic suppression and other fire protection are provided in accordance with Chapter 9. Class II and IIIA liquids shall also be allowed to be stored in basements , provided that automatic suppression and other fire protection are provided in accordance with Chapter 9.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Automatic Sprinkler System
body: The storage of distilled spirits and wines shall be protected by an approved automatic sprinkler system as required by Chapter 9.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Hazard Identification Signs
body: Unless otherwise exempted, visible hazard identification signs, as specified in NFPA 704 for the for the specific material contained, shall be placed on stationary containers and above-ground tanks; at entrances to locations where hazardous materials are stored, dispensed, used or handled in quantities requiring a permit; and at specific entrances and locations designated by the building official.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Maintenance and Style
body: Signs and markings required by Section 456.9 shall not be obscured; shall be in English as a primary language or in symbols allowed by this code; shall be durable; and the size, color and lettering shall be approved.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Piers and Wharves
body: See Section 101.2.1 for the scope of regulation for piers and wharves.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Scope
body: This section shall apply to regulated piers and wharves constructed, in whole or in part, of combustible materials and to regulated piers and wharves constructed of noncombustible materials having less than 2-hour fire-resistive protection of the structural elements or pier deck.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Fire-Extinguishing Systems
body: Automatic fire-extinguishing systems shall be installed as specified in Section 903.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Physical Protection
body: Where sprinkler piping and fire-extinguishing equipment are subject to damage by floating debris, barriers shall be provided to exclude or protect against such debris. Protection from corrosion and freezing shall be provided where necessary.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Subdivision of Substructures
body: All substructures of piers shall have the under-deck area subdivided by:Transverse fire walls at intervals not exceeding 450 feet (137 169 mm) and a maximum area of 50,000 square feet (4625 m2) extending from the low water line to the deck. Where superstructures bridge a required fire wall, the fire wall shall extend to the roof of the superstructure as required for fire walls in accordance with Chapter 7. Transverse fire stops located between fire walls, spacing between fire walls, and fire stops shall not exceed 1550 feet (47 720 mm). Fire stops shall fit tightly against the pier deck and around any structural members of pipes that pass through the fire stop so that an effective barrier to fire and draft is maintained. Fire stops shall extend to the water line. Where aprons or platforms are built along the sides of a pier, fire stops shall extend to the outside edge of such aprons or platforms.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Detailed Requirements
body: Fire walls shall be of reinforced concrete having a fire-resistance rating of 4 hours or other materials of equivalent stability and fire resistance. Fire stops shall be constructed of wood planking built up to a thickness of 4 inches (102 mm) and securely fastened to the structural frame or other construction having equivalent stability and fire resistance.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Superstructures
body: Except as provided in this section, superstructures located on piers and wharves shall be classified for occupancy and type of construction and constructed according to this code.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Mausoleums and Columbariums

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Materials
body: Materials of construction of mausoleums and columbariums shall be as set forth in this code for Type I or II buildings without use of combustible materials. Exception: Interior doors and frames and interior frames for glass screens may be constructed of wood.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Construction
body: All crypt walls and crypt floor slabs shall be constructed of poured-in-place reinforced concrete, without honeycombs. Exception: Crypt opening slabs and the separation slabs between upper and lower spaces of a companion crypt may be installed after entombment and shall be of concrete or mineral-type material.After entombment, the crypt opening shall be sealed in a manner to be odor tight. Crypt walls and floor slabs shall be not less than 3 inches (76 mm) thick.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Loading
body: Each crypt, including each crypt in companion crypts, shall be designed for a minimum total live load of 600 pounds (272 kg) for each individual human remains. No crypt shall contain more than four individual human remains.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Other Methods and Materials
body: Other methods and materials may be considered as set forth in Section 104.10, provided that they have similar qualities of permanence, odor tightness and fire resistance as those identified in this subsection.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Other Occupancies
body: Areas used for assembly shall be classified and constructed as required in this code. Exception: Occupancy separations are not required between mausoleums/columbariums and other occupancies.

section: Chapter 4 Special Detailed Requirements Based on Occupancy and Use
title: Pressure Relief
body: A pressure-relief passage shall be provided leading from each crypt to the roof above the structure. This pressure-balancing shaft shall be located near the rear of each crypt and shall be sealed until the time of entombment and then opened before the crypt is sealed. The rooftop opening shall not be located less than 10 feet (3048 mm) from any cemetery property line. This pressure-relief passage shall be continued to a gravel sump below the lowest crypt slab.
